hero.title: Tandem Paragliding in the Airpark Lienzer Dolomiten
hero.tagline: Tandem Paragliding with KOFLY – Come fly with us!
hero.subtitle: Launch with us from Zettersfeld or Hochstein and enjoy the freedom of flight – front row, feet free, in the stunning mountains of East Tyrol.
hero.trustLine: Certified tandem pilots · KOFLY · Airpark Lienzer Dolomiten

steps.title: Send your request
steps.description: Tell us when you'll be here and how many want to fly. Via the form or WhatsApp.

steps.title: Confirm meeting point
steps.description: We'll get back to you and set the meeting point. It depends on weather and launch site.

steps.title: Ride up & briefing
steps.description: We head to the launch site together. Quick briefing – then we take off.

steps.title: Fly
steps.description: ~20–30 minutes above the Drau Valley. Lienz Dolomites below, views towards the Hohe Tauern.

steps.title: Landing & photos
steps.description: Smooth landing in the valley. Photos and videos from your flight available right after.

launchSites.intro: In the Airpark Lienzer Dolomiten we fly from two launch sites. Which one we use depends on the weather – so you always get the best conditions.

sites.name: Zettersfeld / Steinermandl
sites.description: Spacious launch site above Lienz. Panoramic views of the Lienz Dolomites and the Drau Valley.

sites.name: Hochstein
sites.description: Launch site at Hochstein with views over Lienz and the surrounding mountains.

launchSites.weatherNote: The meeting point is arranged based on weather and launch site – usually near the valley station or at the landing zones.

regions.sectionTitle: Tandem flight – wherever you're staying in the region
regions.sectionSubtitle: Our launch sites in Lienz are easily reachable from across the region.

items.name: Lienz & East Tyrol
items.content: Staying in or near Lienz? The tandem flight is just a short ride away. Our launch sites Zettersfeld and Hochstein are right above town. A perfect highlight for a day out – or a spontaneous plan when the weather cooperates.

items.name: Upper Carinthia
items.content: Lienz is easily reachable from Upper Carinthia. A tandem flight makes a great day trip – arrive in the morning, fly around midday, then explore the old town of Lienz or relax at Tristacher See in the afternoon.

items.name: Drau Valley
items.content: Along the Drau Valley between Spittal and Lienz, our meeting point is practically on the way. If you're holidaying in the Drau Valley, you'll reach us without any detours.

items.name: Möll Valley
items.content: From the Möll Valley, Lienz is a straightforward drive. Combine a day near the Großglockner with a tandem flight over the Lienz Dolomites – two perspectives on the same mountains.

items.name: Isel Valley & Matrei
items.content: From Matrei in East Tyrol it's a short drive to Lienz. A tandem flight is a welcome change from the hiking programme and shows you the valley from a completely different angle.

items.name: Kals am Großglockner
items.content: In Kals, everything revolves around the Großglockner. You can see it from above too – on a tandem flight from Lienz. The drive is manageable, and the flight fits nicely into a day of hiking or a mountain excursion.

items.name: St. Jakob in Defereggental
items.content: The Defereggen Valley is quiet and unspoilt. Looking for a change of pace? A tandem flight from Lienz is the perfect contrast to your daily hikes – and an experience you'll remember.

items.name: Puster Valley – Sillian & Obertilliach
items.content: From the Puster Valley, Lienz is the nearest larger town. Tandem paragliding is an outdoor activity that's not easily available elsewhere here – and the views over the Dolomites are worth it.

weather.title: Weather & safety
weather.content: Whether we fly is the pilot's call, based on current weather conditions. Safety always comes first. If conditions aren't right, we reschedule – no stress.

planning.title: Planning around the weather
planning.content: Mountain weather changes fast. That's why we arrange flight times at short notice and stay flexible. Best to contact us a few days before your preferred date – so we can find the ideal window together.

packingList.title: What to bring
items: Sturdy shoes (hiking boots ideal, no sandals)
Jacket or fleece – it can be noticeably cooler up high

suitability.title: Who can fly?
suitability.content: Tandem flights are suitable for almost everyone – no experience needed. Children can fly too, as long as they can understand and follow the pilot's instructions. If you have any health concerns, just check with us beforehand.

items.question: How long does the flight last?
items.answer: Usually ~20–30 minutes. The exact duration depends on thermal conditions and weather.

items.question: Do I need any experience?
items.answer: No. You fly with a certified tandem pilot who handles all the controls. You just need to take a few running steps at launch.

items.question: What should I wear?
items.answer: Sturdy shoes (hiking boots ideal), long trousers, jacket. It can be noticeably cooler up high than in the valley.

items.question: Can children fly?
items.answer: Generally yes. They need to be able to understand and follow the pilot's instructions.

items.question: What if the weather is bad?
items.answer: Safety comes first. If conditions aren't right, we reschedule. That's why we contact you beforehand to find the best time.

items.question: Where do we meet?
items.answer: We arrange the exact meeting point based on weather and launch site. We usually meet near the valley station or at the landing zones.

items.question: Are photos and videos available?
items.answer: Yes, photo and video recordings of your flight are possible. We'll discuss details when you book.

items.question: How safe is tandem paragliding?
items.answer: Tandem flights are only conducted by certified pilots with certified equipment. Whether we fly always depends on current weather conditions.

items.question: Can I fly if I'm afraid of heights?
items.answer: Many passengers initially have some respect for heights. Most report that flying feels different from standing on a mountain – more like floating.
